stories.title: Hector Martin (from Asahi Linux) about Rosetta not using proprietary M1 features

stories.text:
I work at a consultant company. My project and work is with the client.

Currently, we are developing an awesome project at my client side. Whenever we (client) officially share info on our project, I will forward the same to my colleagues in my consultant company (in Slack channel). It is a great project and I am very excited to share that. But no one in my consultant company usually responds (appreciate/suggest) to my message. It is an active channel and I see reactions to other messages.

It could be something or nothing, but I am interested in what makes people behave like that.

Please share if you have any theory or research to this or similar situations.
stories.title: Why colleagues don't respond to your message when you share your awesome project

stories.text:
That M2 Macbook Air looks spicy but I'm wondering if people have had any issues with the fanless M1 version as a developer?

I work on infrastructure and development work with my M1 Macbook Pro (python, go, terraform, ansible) and use the usual electron apps (slack, teams, vscode). So far, I haven't had any issues with performance, nor I have never heard the fans kick in.

Also, I only need one external monitor.
